poem:
### Learning To Mother

A foreign tongue,  
this language of motherhood,  
spoken softly in the cradles  
of sleepless nights—  
alien phrases,  
shaped by brands  
and whispered needs.  
In the land of milk and fear,  
gentle is the guide,  
gestation of self,  
until home is where  
the heart learns to listen.
